page.title: 14STRAW BURNING IN ASHTON
page.content: As I sit in my garden chair after a busy plum picking session, an acrid smoke and the crackle of burning straw disturbs my peace. Looking towards Broadway Tower a dark blue haze obscures the view and my heart sinks. More hedgerows burned up, trees singed, insects and wild flowers destroyed. I know the lady living in a thatched cottage will be hoping that stray sparks will not ignite her roof. The air is filled with black smuts and the nauseous smell of burnt vegetation. Farmers have been asked to follow government directives on how to dispose of straw, but in this area these directives are usually ignored. Many ways of using straw have been suggested, the latest being the "stropper" machine, which, using a caustic soda treatment can turn straw into cattle feed. Is there hope yet?
